alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 4:49PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Yuma County through 515 PM MDT... At 448 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of St Petersburg to 3 miles north of Lone Star to 4 miles south of Burdett. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Yuma County, including the following locations... Clarkville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
